channel.title: Ghost, after-life, and supernatural forces
channel.description:
I know there are a lot of topics on life-after-death and God, but I kinda wanted to give you my perspective on things and have you all explain your ideas.
Before I start, I would like to say that I am Catholic and I believe in God. I have just been thinking a lot about these topics lately and I am trying to come to some sort of conclusion to get it off my mind.
First off, Ghosts. Do you believe in them? I don't know if I do or not. They seem like they are something that could exist. In order to though, there would have to be some sort of supernatural forces (i.e God) because they are supernatural themselves.
What determines that you become a ghost? I have heard many stories about ghosts, some were nice and some were scary. I think that our lives on earth determine how we become ghosts and that someone above all of us is the judge of it. If we behave well and accomplish what we want to in life then we will get to go to "heaven," if we die with sins on our back then we will be condemned to an after-life of being a ghost.
I am kinda rambling on now, so I will stop. Let me know what you all think. Wouldn't there have to be some supernatural forces for there to be ghosts? Are ghosts even real, or something created by us when we are scared? What determines that someone becomes a ghost?
Feel free to add any extra points.

I do not believe in anything supernatural which by definition cannot be proven, therefore no

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:6, topic:470691”]Do you have any proof to back what you say? (Just being the devil’s advocate. I think there is some truth to what you are saying, but I don’t know if I could switch my mind into thinking that as I have grown up with it all my life.)

I am also open-minded, so I am willing to listen.[/quote]

by definition ghosts are supernatural and therefore by definition cannot be proven to exist

it is also up to the claimant to prove their claim, ghosts are the claim being made and as of this current moment in time, there is absolutely no evidence for ghosts and given the definitions of ghosts, will probably never will be
